alert.note: Alert for Phillips (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 28 at 11:45PM MDT until June 29 at 12:30AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado, including the following county, Phillips. * WHEN...Until 245 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1145 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Wildhorse Creek and Frenchman Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pleasant Valley and Amherst.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
